p: The species-specific cover and biomass depended on the species identity (Df = 3, χ 2 = 53.95, p < 0.0001 and Df = 3, χ 2 = 298.04, p < 0.0001, Figures 2A,B, respectively, and Supplementary Material 3), with a higher cover and biomass produced by the species A. millefolium and lower values for S. laeve. The two grasses species B. ciliatus and C. canadensis had an intermediate cover and biomass. The species-specific cover and biomass were independent from the presence of earthworms alone (Df = 1, χ 2 = 0.004, p = 0.95 and Df = 1, χ 2 = 0.29, p = 0.59, respectively), and in interaction with the species identity (respectively, Df = 3, χ 2 = 0.51, p = 0.92 and Df = 3, χ 2 = 0.94, p = 0.81), while the tree biomass slightly decreased the species biomass but not the species cover (Df = 1, χ 2 = 2,88, p = 0.09 and Df = 1, χ 2 = 0.71, p = 0.40, respectively).
